quotes: Department of Justice's Honors Program in the Land and Natural Resources Division (1976–77)
Special Assistant to the Director of ACTION, the Federal volunteer agency (1978–79)
His political career began in 1972, when he worked for George McGovern's unsuccessful presidential campaign.
Counselor to Democratic Leader Senator Thomas Daschle (1995–96)
Chief Counsel for the Senate Agriculture Committee (1987–88)
Counsel on the Majority Staff of the Senate Judiciary Committee (1979–81)
In 1988, he and his brother Tony co-founded Podesta Associates, Inc.
Podesta in 1993 served as both an assistant to the president and as deputy chief of staff.

Earlier, from January 1993 to 1995, he was assistant to the president, staff secretary and a senior policy adviser on government information, privacy, telecommunications security and regulatory policy.
In 1998, he became President Clinton's chief of staff in the second Clinton administration
Podesta served in the position until the end of Clinton's time in office in January 2001.
In 2003, Podesta founded the Center for American Progress, a liberal think tank in Washington, D.C., and served as its president and CEO until he stepped down in 2011.
In 2003, Podesta founded the Center for American Progress, a liberal think tank in Washington, D.C., and served as its president and CEO until he stepped down in 2011.
Podesta meeting with Bill Clinton and Georgetown University president John J. DeGioia in 2006.
